title: Computable Numbers with an Application to the Entscheidungsproblem”,\ Proceedings of the London Mathematical Society
Uber formal unentscheidbare Satze der Principia Mathernatica und verwant der\ Systeme
An unsolvable problem of elementary number theory”
A note on the Entscheidungsprob1em”
Theory of functions of a real variable

note: ❑ Steve Oualline, Practical C++ Programming (Second Edition), O’Reilly, 2003, ISBN: 0-596-00419-2.
title: This book requires no knowledge of C++, but experience with high-level object-oriented languages is assumed
An introductory C++ text that assumes no prior programming experience. ❑ Walter Savitch, Problem Solving with C++: The Object of Programming

author.literal: General C++ ❑ Marshall Cline, C++ FAQ LITE, www.parashift.com/c++-faq-lite. ❑ Marshall Cline, Greg Lomow, and Mike Giru, C++ FAQs

note: The printed version contains more information than the online version, but the material available online should be sufficient for most professional C++ programmers.
title: This book assumes no prior programming experience. It is often used as a textbook in introductory programming courses
ISBN: 0-201-30983-1. This compilation of frequently asked questions from the comp.lang.c++ newsgroup is useful for quickly looking up a specific point about C++

note: Provides 99 specific tips for C++ programming.
Practical Programming (Second Edition), Prentice Hall, 2003, ISBN: 0-130-35313-2.
❑ Scott Meyers, More Effective C++: 35 New Ways to Improve Your Programs and Designs, Addison Wesley, 1996, ISBN: 0-201-63371-X.
title: The second volume of Eckel’s book covers more advanced C++ topics. It’s also available at no cost online at www.bruceeckel.com. ❑ Ray Lischner, C++ in a Nutshell, O’Reilly, 2003, ISBN: 0-596-00298-X. A C++ reference, covering everything from the basics to more advanced material. ❑ Scott Meyers, Effective C++
50 Specific Ways to Improve Your Programs and Designs

publisher: ❑ Stephen Prata, C++ Primer Plus, Sams Publishing
title: These two books provide excellent tips-and-tricks on commonly misused and misunderstood features of C++
One of the most comprehensive C++ books available. ❑ Bjarne Stroustrup, The C++ Programming Language

note: ❑ The C++ Standard: Incorporating Technical Corrigendum No. 1, John Wiley & Sons, 2003, ISBN: 0-470-84674-7.
title: The “Bible” of C++ books, written by the designer of C++ himself. Every C++ programmer should own a copy of this book, but it can be a bit obscure in places for the C++ novice

This book is almost 800 pages of dense standard-eze. It doesn’t explain how to use C++, only what the formal rules are. We don’t recommend this book unless you really want to understand every detail of C++
Stream Manipulators and Iterators in C++
Where is my Character?, www.unicode.org/standard/where
The best resource for finding Unicode characters, charts, and tables

author.literal: The C++ Standard Library ❑ Nicolai M. Josuttis

note: This book is similar to the Josuttis text, but covers only the STL part of the standard library.
title: The C++ Standard Library: A Tutorial and Reference

ISBN: 0-201-37926-0. This book covers the entire standard library, including I/O streams and strings as well as the containers and algorithms. It’s an excellent reference. ❑ Scott Meyers, Effective STL: 50 Specific Ways to Improve Your Use of the Standard Template Library
Meyers wrote this book in the same spirit as his “Effective C++” books. It provides targeted tips for using the STL, but is not a reference or tutorial
The C Programming Language

note: ❑ Eric S. Roberts, Programming Abstractions in C: A Second Course in Computer Science,
title: K and R,” as this book is known, is an excellent reference on the C language. It’s not as useful for learning it the first time. ❑ Peter Prinz, Tony Crawford (Translator
ISBN: 0-596-00436-2. A concise reference to all things C
The Art and Science of C: A Library Based Introduction to Computer Science
These two books provide a great introduction to programming in C with good style. They are often used as textbooks in introductory programming courses
This book provides step-by-step instructions for using JNI to integrate Java with other languages, including C++

author.literal: Algorithms and Data Structures ❑ Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, and Clifford Stein

note: ❑ Donald E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming Volume 3: Sorting and Searching (Third Edition), Addison Wesley, 1998, ISBN: 0-201-89685-0. For those of you who enjoy mathematical rigor, there is no better algorithms and data structures text than Knuth’s three-volume tome. It is probably inaccessible without undergraduate knowledge of mathematics or theoretical computer science.
title: Introduction to Algorithms

ISBN: 0-262-03293-7. This text is one of the most popular introductory algorithms books, covering all the common data structures and algorithms. The authors learned algorithms and data structures as an undergraduate from the first edition of this book
The Art of Computer Programming
The Art of Computer Programming Volume 2: Seminumerical Algorithms
An approachable reference to data structures and algorithms
❑ sourceforge.net at www.sourceforge.net
This Web site hosts many open-source projects. It’s a great resource for finding useful open-source software
TRW Defense Systems Group, A Spiral Model of Software Development and Enhancement
This landmark paper described the state of software development at the time and proposed the Spiral Model
Extreme Programming Explained: Embrace Change
One of several books in a series that promote Extreme Programming as a new approach to software development
Quality Software Project Management
A guidebook for anybody who is responsible for the management of the software development process
Facts and Fallacies of Software Engineering

note: ❑ Philippe Kruchten, Rational Unified Process: An Introduction (Second Edition), Addison Wesley, 2000, ISBN: 0-201-70710-1.
title: This book discusses various aspects of the software development process and exposes hidden truisms along the way
Provides an overview of RUP, including its mission and processes. ❑ Edward Yourdon, Death March
ISBN: 0-131-43635-X. A wonderfully enlightening book about the politics and realities of software development

author.literal: Programming Style ❑ Martin Fowler, Kent Beck, John Brant, William Opdyke, Don Roberts

title: Refactoring: Improving the Design of Existing Code
ISBN: 0-201-48567-2. This classic book espouses the practice of recognizing and improving bad code
Practical Standards for Microsoft Visual Basic .NET
Exhibits the tenets of Microsoft Windows coding style, using Visual Basic
A highly configurable program that generates documentation from source code and comments

author.literal: Computer Architecture ❑ David A. Patterson and John L. Hennessy, Computer Organization & Design

note: Third Edition), Morgan Kaufman, 2002, ISBN: 1-558-60596-7. These two books provide all the information most software engineers ever need to know about computer architecture.
title: The Hardware/Software Interface
Computer Architecture: A Quantitative Approach
❑ Rational Software from IBM
Rational Purify is an excellent (but not free) memory error–debugging tool. ❑ Valgrind, at http://valgrind.kde.org. An open-source memory-debugging tool for Linux

author.literal: Distributed Objects ❑ Jim Farley, Java Distributed Computing, O’Reilly

title: ISBN: 1-56592-206-9. Provides a Java-centric view of distributed computing technologies. ❑ Ron Hipschman, How SETI@home Works
Interesting background on the SETI@home project, which uses distributed computing to analyze data from space
Web Services Essentials, O’Reilly, 2002, ISBN: 0-596-00224-6. This book explains the emerging concept of Web services and the use of SOAP for distributed computing

container-title: Programming Web Services with SOAP, O’Reilly, 2001, ISBN
title: Includes discussions of associated technologies like XML schema, XPath, and XHTML. ❑ James Snell, Doug Tidwell, Pavel Kulchenko

note: Examples are provided in Java, Perl, C#, and Visual Basic. ❑ Eric van der Vlist, XML Schema, O’Reilly, 2002, ISBN: 0-596-00252-1.
title: This book discusses SOAP and related technologies, such as UDDI and WSDL
This book tackles the difficult topic of XML Schema and discusses the nuances of the language. ❑ Altova Software xmlspy
Information about the xmlspy software package from Altova Software

note: Called the “Gang of Four” book (because of its four authors), this text is the seminal work in design patterns.
title: Modern C++ Design: Generic Programming and Design Patterns Applied

ISBN: 0-201-70431-5. Offers an approach to C++ programming employing highly reusable code and patterns. ❑ Cunningham and Cunningham, The Portland Pattern Repository, www.c2.com/cgi/ wiki?WelcomeVisitors. You could spend all day browsing through this community-edited Web site about design patterns
Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
